Authors:
Hongyan Huang, Shuda Yang, Niankai Zeng, Guoli Zhang, Yu
Hu, Liping Tang
Title:
Hygrophorus parvirussula sp. nov., a new edible mushroom from
southwestern China
Abstract:
A Chinese species of Hygrophorus with a purplish red or
pinkish red pileus, treated as “H. russula” is taxonomically
reevaluated, including sequences of “H. russula” from GenBank.
Phylogenetic analysis of the internal transcribed spacer region
indicated that “H. russula” from different continents is a complex of at
least eight phylogenetic species. Chinese entities are distinct from
previously described species of Hygrophorus, including the European H.
russula. Therefore, we describe it as a new species, namely H.
parvirussula sp. nov., which differs from H. russula by its smaller
basidiomata, slightly larger basidiospores, and the presence of
cheilocystidia and pleurocystidia.
